formats.name: micro_manifesto
formats.instruction: Declare a personal philosophy or credo in just a few sentences. Make it bold, memorable, and uniquely yours. No justification — say it like a rock anthem. 2-3 sentences max.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Share a common piece of advice and explain why it backfires or doesn't work for you. Be specific and give a real-life example. 3-5 sentences.

formats.name: time_travel_diary
formats.instruction: Write a diary entry from the perspective of yourself 20 years in the future, reflecting on today's events or choices. Be imaginative and sincere. 150-300 words.

formats.name: fractal_story
formats.instruction: Tell a story that starts small, then zooms out twice: first to a personal scale, then to a societal/global scale. Each zoom should be 1-2 paragraphs. Total: 220-350 words.

formats.name: parallel_universe_pitch
formats.instruction: Describe how a familiar thing would work in an alternate universe. Be playful or bizarre. Use details and examples. 80-130 words.

formats.name: burning_question
formats.instruction: Pose a question you've always wondered about, then speculate wildly about possible answers. No research—just your gut. 2-5 sentences.

formats.name: blame_the_object
formats.instruction: Pick an everyday object and write a rant blaming it for some annoyance in your life. Personify the object and exaggerate its impact. 30-70 words.

formats.name: hidden_skill_reveal
formats.instruction: Confess a weird or unexpected skill you have. Describe how you discovered it and why it's useful (or useless). Minimum three sentences.

formats.name: encrypted_memory
formats.instruction: Share a cryptic or coded description of a personal memory—no clear details, just clues, metaphors, and fragments. Let readers guess what happened. 40-110 words.

title_styles: Write a poetic title — use metaphor, alliteration, or a surprising image.
Write an absurdist title — make it strange and unpredictable.
Write a challenge title — dare the reader to disagree or try something.
Write a title that reveals a twist or counterintuitive idea.
Write a nostalgic title — reference memories, old days, or past experiences.
structure_variants: Begin with a quote (real or fictional), then reflect on its meaning.
Use two-column comparison (e.g., 'then vs now' or 'expected vs actual')
Build the post as if you're drafting a letter to your past or future self.
Alternate between short and long sentences for a rhythmic effect.
Organize your thoughts in a series of riddles or coded clues.
